alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 8:07PM MST until August 18 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Beaver Creek in southern Coconino County Arizona... eastern Yavapai County Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 804 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along and near Beaver Creek. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rimrock near Beaver Creek, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville near Beaver Creek, Montezuma Castle National Monument, V Bar V Visitors Center and Wet Beaver Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 291 and 293. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jacks Canyon, Brady Canyon, Long Canyon, Beaver Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Russell Wash and Walker Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
